description: NextJS Dashboard Application - SaaS-style dashboard with Sanity CMS integration, Tailwind CSS styling, and responsive layout

userStories.title: Initialize NextJS project with TypeScript and Tailwind
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a properly configured NextJS project so I can build features on a solid foundation.
acceptanceCriteria: NextJS 14+ initialized with App Router using create-next-app
TypeScript configured with strict mode in tsconfig.json
Tailwind CSS installed and configured with tailwind.config.ts
Project runs successfully with npm run dev
userStories.notes: NextJS 16.1.6 with Tailwind v4 (CSS-based config instead of tailwind.config.ts)

userStories.title: Configure ESLint and Prettier
userStories.description: As a developer, I need consistent code formatting and linting rules.
acceptanceCriteria: ESLint configured with NextJS recommended rules
ESLint and Prettier configs do not conflict
npm run lint passes without errors
userStories.notes: Using eslint-config-prettier and eslint-plugin-prettier for ESLint 9 flat config integration

userStories.title: Create project folder structure
userStories.description: As a developer, I need an organized folder structure so the codebase remains maintainable.
acceptanceCriteria: Add placeholder index.ts files to establish structure
userStories.notes: Placeholder index.ts files without exports to avoid TypeScript module errors

userStories.title: Implement root layout with global styles
userStories.description: As a user, I want a consistent layout across all pages with proper styling.
acceptanceCriteria: Root layout in app/layout.tsx with metadata configuration
Global Tailwind styles applied in globals.css
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Using NextJS Viewport export for meta viewport, Inter font via next/font/google

userStories.title: Build Button component
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a reusable Button component with multiple variants.
acceptanceCriteria: Supports variants: primary, secondary, outline, ghost
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Button component with primary, secondary, outline, ghost variants using forwardRef

userStories.title: Build Card component
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a reusable Card component with header, content, and footer slots.
acceptanceCriteria: Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Card, CardHeader, CardContent, CardFooter subcomponents with forwardRef and className support

userStories.title: Build Badge and Input components
userStories.description: As a developer, I need Badge and Input UI primitives.
acceptanceCriteria: Badge component in /components/ui/badge.tsx with color variants
Input component in /components/ui/input.tsx with label and error states
Both accept className prop for customization
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Badge with default/success/warning/error/info variants, Input with label and error states using forwardRef

userStories.title: Create sidebar navigation component
userStories.description: As a user, I want a sidebar navigation so I can access different dashboard sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Sidebar with w-64 (256px), nav items with SVG icons, active state using usePathname hook

userStories.title: Create header component with mobile menu
userStories.description: As a user, I want a header bar and mobile navigation drawer.
acceptanceCriteria: Mobile menu button visible on small screens
Sidebar becomes drawer overlay on mobile (collapsible)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Header with mobile menu toggle, Sidebar drawer overlay on mobile, dynamic breadcrumbs from pathname

userStories.title: Create dashboard layout
userStories.description: As a user, I want a dashboard layout that combines sidebar, header, and content area.
acceptanceCriteria: Main content area with proper padding
Responsive layout works on mobile, tablet, desktop
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Dashboard layout with Sidebar hidden on mobile (lg:flex), Header with mobile menu, main content area with p-4 lg:p-6 padding

userStories.title: Set up Sanity CMS project
userStories.description: As a developer, I need Sanity CMS initialized for content management.
acceptanceCriteria: Sanity config file created at sanity.config.ts
userStories.notes: Sanity v3 installed with next-sanity and @sanity/vision, config at sanity.config.ts, env vars documented in .env.local.example

userStories.title: Create Sanity client and query helpers
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a type-safe Sanity client for fetching content.
acceptanceCriteria: Type-safe query helper function that accepts GROQ queries
Client uses environment variables for configuration
userStories.notes: Sanity client with sanityFetch<T> generic helper using next-sanity createClient, env vars for projectId, dataset, apiVersion

userStories.title: Create CMS schemas for page and announcement
userStories.description: As a content editor, I need schemas to manage pages and announcements.
acceptanceCriteria: Schema for 'page' content type with title, slug, content fields
Schema for 'announcement' with title, message, type, active fields
userStories.notes: Page schema with title, slug, content (block array). Announcement with title, message, type (info/warning/error), active boolean. Schemas in lib/cms/schemas/ and registered in sanity.config.ts

userStories.title: Create CMS schema for navigation and add Studio route
userStories.description: As a content editor, I need navigation schema and access to Sanity Studio.
acceptanceCriteria: Schema for 'navigationItem' with label, href, icon, order fields
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: navigationItem schema with label, href, icon (dropdown options), order fields. Studio route at /studio using next-sanity/studio NextStudio component with custom layout.

userStories.title: Create loading skeleton components
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see loading skeletons while content loads.
acceptanceCriteria: CardSkeleton component for loading card states
ContentSkeleton component for loading text content
Uses Tailwind animate-pulse for loading effect
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Skeleton, CardSkeleton, ContentSkeleton components with animate-pulse effect. CardSkeleton has header/content layout, ContentSkeleton has configurable lines prop.

userStories.title: Create error boundary and error pages
userStories.description: As a user, I want clear feedback when errors occur.
acceptanceCriteria: Error boundary component with retry option
404 page at app/not-found.tsx with navigation back to dashboard
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: ErrorBoundary class component in components/ui/error-boundary.tsx with retry option. 404 page at app/not-found.tsx with dashboard navigation. Global error page at app/error.tsx with reset() and dashboard link.

userStories.title: Implement dynamic page rendering from CMS
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see content from the CMS rendered on pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Fetches page content by slug from Sanity
Returns 404 for missing pages using notFound()
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Dynamic route using [slug] param, sanityFetch with GROQ query, PortableText for block content, loading.tsx with ContentSkeleton

userStories.title: Create dashboard home page
userStories.description: As a user, I want a dashboard home page showing an overview.
acceptanceCriteria: Grid of stat cards using Card component (placeholder data)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Dashboard home with welcome section, 4-column responsive stats grid (Total Users, Active Projects, Revenue, Pending Tasks), Recent Activity list with placeholder data

userStories.title: Add announcements banner to dashboard
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see active announcements from the CMS.
acceptanceCriteria: Displays banner at top of dashboard if announcements exist
Supports different announcement types (info, warning, error)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: AnnouncementBanner async server component fetches active announcements with GROQ query, supports info/warning/error types with color-coded styling and icons, integrated into dashboard layout below header
